subject: Re: [junit] ETA?
msgSnippet: There s some good news here.  If you use the backward compatibility features in JUnit 4, you should be able to use many JUnit 3-aware test runners, including
messageBody:
There's some good news here. If you use the backward compatibility
features in JUnit 4, you should be able to use many JUnit 3-aware test
runners, including Eclipse and ant, today.

David Saff

Bradley, Todd wrote:

> Another important question to ask is what's the ETA for
> JUnit 4 support in the rest of your toolset. For instance,
> if you use ant or Eclipse or any of the JUnit add-ons, when
> will they be ready for JUnit 4?
>
>
> Todd.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> > Behalf Of mattpeddlesden
> > Sent: Tuesday, January 17, 2006 6:22 AM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] ETA?
> >
> > Apologies, I fully expect a good telling off for asking this
> > but I just can't find any clues...
> >
> > We're currently developing a new test strategy and
> > implementation for our products and it seems that Junit 4 is
> > quite close but not here fully yet.
> >
> > o What's the rough ETA (Q1, Q2 etc)?
> > o Is the current Junit 4 worth using anyway?
> >
> > Thanks in advance!
> >
> > Regards
> > Matthew Peddlesden
> > Head of Product Development, ValidSoft Ltd.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
